page.title: 05AGE AND HOUSEHOLDS
page.content: Out of the 204 people included in the survey only 2 were between the ages of 21-25 & only 3 from 26-30.In short 5 out of 204 were in their 20's.Due to the way the questionaires were distributed the largest group was the 11-15's, having 35 people in it. These childrens parents made up the next largest groups, those of 36-40 & 41-45.There are very few over 60, 8 to be precise. The average number of people per household was 3.8 which was 0.4 less than the national average of 4.2 .Of all households{48.1%}had {4}people.The next largest group was {3}people which accounted for{18.5%}of all households. Households with elderley people accounted for{11.1%}.Only{1.9%}of all households were extended (i.e. with grandparents & uncles etc. living there as well).
